e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (08:57): btw, "Writing HTML" applies to authors just as much as it applies to tools
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (08:57): that not all authors can understand it is a reason to create tutorials and such
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (08:58): not to rename the section
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:58): yes but you will create more questions, and maintenance by not renaming
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:58): when a simple change of names
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:58): avoid a loooooot of misunderstanding

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (08:59): I think it would be highly inappropriate for the spec not to detail exactly how authors should do things
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (08:59): this is a "DOS attack" for any human author -> "Optionally, a single U+FEFF BYTE ORDER MARK (BOM) character."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:00): So saying it's just for tools is wrong

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:00): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: so better to not encourage them how to write HTML document

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:01): the more I read this section, the more I see that there is nothing for human authors in there
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:01): talking about http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/html5/spec/Overview.html#writing
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:01): I'm a human and author...
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): A DOCTYPE must consist of the following characters, in this order:
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): 1. A U+003C LESS-THAN SIGN (<) character.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): 2. A U+0021 EXCLAMATION MARK (!) character.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): 3. A U+0044 LATIN CAPITAL LETTER D or U+0064 LATIN SMALL LETTER D character.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): 4. A U+004F LATIN CAPITAL LETTER O or U+006F LATIN SMALL LETTER O character.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): this is not usable by an author
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): [15:01]  &lt e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0> I'm a human and author...     AND A GEEK
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:02): sure
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:02): You are disqualified ;)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:02): i'm not saying authors have to use that section directly
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:03): i'm saying we should pretend that section doesn't apply to authors, because then there's no section that does
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:04): then you have to start the spec at the top of the specification in big red blink letter with trumpets: "You are an author, go away"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:07): and then the more logical would be that a big part of section 3 is out of HTML 5 as it stands now.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:07): http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/html5/spec/Overview.html#semantics
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:07): so it will be easier to not have misunderstanding
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:08): that's about HTML elements

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:09): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 forget who you are, and take the seat of someone who discover or are used to HTML 4.01. It is not that difficult, isn't it? Stay humble and think about other people.

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:11): I have seen people reading specs, I have seen people asking questions.

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:12): at the end of the day, someone would have to either rewrite that section to make it more author friendly or write another section that says exactly the same and is more author friendly
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:12): there are valid questions from Web designers. They express concerns.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:12): as long as either doesn't happen, there's not much to discuss I think
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:12): brushing away concerns because we are supposed to know better
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:12): at least for me
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:12): that's too bad
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:13): I don't see how your proposed solution makes things better
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:14): It actually makes the spec less useful for authors who can read that section as it suddenly no longer applies to them
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:14): They wouldn't be able to figure out how to write documents?!
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:14): ok let's take it in another way

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (09:16): the person who will read HTML 4 Specification who are not implementers of authoring tools, but hand coding. What do they benefit of reading the section 8.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:17): just as with any other part of the spec
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:17): at some point the sections will contain some more examples and all will be fine
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (09:18): and maybe someone will step up and write this primer at some point and it will be better
